sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A divine prospective: representing the just mans peacefull end. In a funerall sermon preached at Katharine Creechurch, Aug. 14. 1649. at the enterrement of the remaines of the Right Worshipfull and truly religious, Sir John Gayr, Knight: deceased July 20. 1649. / By Nathaniel Hardy, M.A. and preacher to the parish of Dionis Back-Church. Hardy, Nathaniel, 1618-1670.
[4], 30, [2] p.
Printed for John Clark, and are to be sold at his shop under S. Peters Church in Cornhill, London : 1649.
The last leaf is blank. Annotation on Thomason copy: "7ber [i.e. September] 19". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Printed for John Clark, and are to be sold at his shop under S. Peters Church in Cornhill, London : 1649.
